instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: 2879 green light, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL> liquid spill entry at USB ports
threads.message: Not getting any s4 or higher rails other than found some voltage near the USB's on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3_RTUSB_B_ILIM</SIGNAL> and /_LTUSB_B_ILIM caps. Only noticeable corrosion was at <CHIP>U4650</CHIP>. Unfortunately the customer tried cleaning the board first.

threads.title: 2879 green light, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL> liquid spill entry at USB ports
2879 green light, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL> liquid spill entry at USB ports
threads.message:
That started the board?! It actually ended up booting. I know I had tried to get the board to start with smc bypass but I hadn't triggered the onoff since reflowing the SMC. 

Does this board not start upon connecting to MS1? I don't recall but am thinking that is typical for 2010 and earlier... At this point I believe everything is working except the battery which probably toasted from the spill. I'll run it through testing and report back if further issues. 

Thanks!

threads.title: 2879 green light, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL> liquid spill entry at USB ports
threads.message:
This is MCP (nVidia) based board.
It only starts pressing power button...
